import java.time.Duration import java.time.Instant
Instant startTime = project.properties['testExecutionStartTimestamp'] Instant endTime = Instant.now()
Duration overallTestsTimeoutInSeconds = Duration.ofSeconds(Integer.parseInt('${overall.tests.execution.timeout.in.seconds}')) Duration timeElapsed = Duration.between(startTime, endTime);
if(timeElapsed.compareTo(overallTestsTimeoutInSeconds) <= 0) return;
newLine = System.getProperty("line.separator")
String message = new StringBuilder() .append(newLine).append(newLine) .append(String.format('Test execution time (%s) was more than expected time (%s), hence failing the build.', timeElapsed, overallTestsTimeoutInSeconds)) .append(newLine) .append('Optimize the time consuming tests or increase the expected timeout.') .append(newLine).append(newLine) .append(String.format('Test execution start time: [%s]', new Date(startTime.toEpochMilli()))) .append(newLine) .append(String.format('Test execution end time: [%s]', new Date(endTime.toEpochMilli()))) .append(newLine) .append('Test execution duration: ' + timeElapsed) .append(newLine) .append('Overall tests execution timeout: ' + overallTestsTimeoutInSeconds)
throw new IllegalStateException(message)
